in.teramatrix.googleservices.service

Class RouteDesigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng,java.lang.Void,com.google.android.gms.maps.model.Polyline[]>
      • in.teramatrix.googleservices.service.RouteDesigner

  • public class RouteDesigner
extends android.os.AsyncTask<com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng,java.lang.Void,com.google.android.gms.maps.model.Polyline[]>
    The Google Maps Directions API is a service that calculates directions between locations using an HTTP request. This class is written to design routes on the Google Map. It is easy to use class having Builder Pattern. You can search for directions for several modes of transportation, including transit, driving, walking or cycling. Directions may specify origins, destinations and waypoints either as text strings (e.g. "Chicago, IL" or "Darwin, NT, Australia") or as latitude/longitude coordinates. The Directions API can return multi-part directions using a series of waypoints. But this class can only process LatLng so please don't pass origin/desination or waypoints as string.
    Author:
    Mohsin Khan
    Date:
    1/5/2016

    • Field Detail

      • json

        private java.lang.String json
        Server response without parsing

      • map

        private com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap map
        Getting map instance here because after successful response of this API, route will be drawn here on this instance of GoogleMap.

      • context

        private android.content.Context context
        This class will draw route here, that's why context is needed here to run the statements on UI thread.

      • origin

        private com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng origin
        Starting point from where route will be drawn on the map.

      • destination

        private com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng destination
        End point till where route will be drawn on the map.

      • mode

        private java.lang.String mode
        When you calculate directions, you may specify the transportation mode to use. By default, directions are calculated as driving directions.

      • sensor

        private boolean sensor
        The Google Maps API previously required that you include the sensor parameter to indicate whether your application used a sensor to determine the user's location. This parameter is no longer required.

      • alternatives

        private boolean alternatives
        If set to true, specifies that the Directions service may provide more than one route alternative in the response. Note that providing route alternatives may increase the response time from the server.

      • baseLayer

        private com.google.android.gms.maps.model.PolylineOptions baseLayer
        There are two polylines on the map to make emboss effect, It is one of them. This Polyline will be in bottom.

      • upperLayer

        private com.google.android.gms.maps.model.PolylineOptions upperLayer
        There are two polylines on the map to make emboss effect, It is one of them. This Polyline will be on top of bottom layer.

      • autoZoom

        private boolean autoZoom
        If this bit will be true then Map camera will be zoom over there automatically.

      • listener

        private RouteDesigner.DesignerListener listener
        This will publish results to your app module. Just pass an implemented version of this listener in this class and results will be in your hand.

      • client

        private final okhttp3.OkHttpClient client
        Okhttp is a third party library to interact with the server. OkHttpClient is a factory for calls, which can be used to send HTTP requests and read their responses.

        public void design(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng... waypoints)
        It is just like build method of Builder Pattern. It will execute this AsyncTask
        Parameters:
